main event: On April 19, 1958, the crew of a B-47 aircraft observed a round, silver object in the sky above them near Syracuse, New York.
interesting points: The object was first thought to be a balloon but remained visible for twenty minutes and did not disappear as expected., The object changed colors from bright white to reddish., The altitude of the B-47 was 32,000 feet with excellent visibility., The sighting occurred during clear weather conditions with no unusual activity reported., Several observers confirmed seeing the object, all providing the same description.
witness description: crew members of a B-47 aircraft
